name: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Children Undergoing Intravenous Placement in the Pediatric Emergency Department: Distraction to Reduce Pain and Distress
description: This study will test if iPads are useful to help lower pain and distress for children who are visiting an emergency department and need an intravenous line put in. The results from this study could be important for many children receiving medical care, as distraction is safe and the use of iPads is enjoyable for many children.

funder.name: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

distribution.name: Ali_iPad_Study_data_collection_form.pdf
distribution.description: This REDCap project has data collection forms and instructions for the following: Consent & Screening; Parent Patient Interview Form; Pre-Procedure and Faces Pain Scale-Revised (Baseline Heart Rate, Faces Pain Score); During / Post Procedure (Time of the start of the Procedure; Time IV attempt / procedure complete; Highest Heart Rate during the procedure; Post Procedure Face Pain Score); Nurse Satisfaction; Pre-Procedure State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)– Parent; Post-Procedure STAI – Parent; Parent Satisfaction; RA Chart Review; End Of Study.

distribution.name: Ali _iPad_Study_nurse_consent.doc
distribution.description: Nurse consent form and information sheet for A Randomized Controlled Trial of Children Undergoing Intravenous Placement in the Pediatric Emergency Department.

distribution.name: Ali_iPad_Study_parent_consent.doc
distribution.description: Parent consent form and information sheet for A Randomized Controlled Trial of Children Undergoing Intravenous Placement in the Pediatric Emergency Department
